H0.text: In which of Thomas Hardy's novels is Bathsheba Everdene the heroine. Tess of the d'Urbervilles

H1.text: In which of Thomas Hardy's novels is Bathsheba Everdene the heroine. Jude the Obscure

H2.text: In which of Thomas Hardy's novels is Bathsheba Everdene the heroine. The Return of the Native

H3.text: In which of Thomas Hardy's novels is Bathsheba Everdene the heroine. Gabriel Oak

A4.text: It describes the life and relationships of Bathsheba Everdene with her lonely neighbour William Boldwood, the faithful shepherd Gabriel Oak, and the faithless soldier Sgt. Frank Troy.

A5.text: Comyns Carr/Hardy's version was finally staged at the Royal Court Theatre in Liverpool, where it opened on 27 February 1882 as Far from The Madding Crowd, with Marion Terry as Bathsheba and Charles Kelly as Oak.
